is a town on the River Medway in the north of the
. Together with its neighbouring towns of
it forms a large urban area known as the Medway Towns.

is located south of the Town Centre shopping area. Trains are operated by

, 08457 484950.

Fast trains operate to/from London Victoria (typical journey time 45 - 60 minutes) and slower stopping trains to/from London Charing Cross/Waterloo/London Bridge via Dartford (typical journey time 60 - 65 minutes). Trains to/from Ramsgate & Dover Priory also serve Chatham. 

High Speed 1 trains from London St Pancras and
serve Chatham. For local journeys these trains are more expensive than the other routes.

value: content=An old naval dockyard now run as a museum. Open daily in spring and summer, weekends only in winter.
content=Dock Road, Chatham, ME4 4UB. Open daily in summer.
Image:Thunderbolt Pier and Kingswear Castle, Chatham - geograph.org.uk - 733660.jpg

content=Chatham, ME4 4BT. Good basic turkish restaurant. Although they do kebabs (and other stuff) it is nothing like a kebab shop. A good 3 course dinner with soft drinks (they do sell wine and beer) cost £10.

The Medway Council list accommodation on their website

value: content=Capstone Road, Gillingham, ME7 3JE 0870 770 5964. 40 bed summer hostel about 4 miles from Chatham, housed in a districtive converted Oast House in a semi-rural setting.
content=Avenue, Chatham, Kent. ME4 6BB, About 5 minutes walk from Chatham station. Single rooms £40, doubles £60.
, Maidstone Road, Chatham, ME5 9SF 0870 400 9069. Modern hotel about 4 miles from the town centre.

content=Western Avenue, Chatham Historic Dockyard, ME4 4NT, 0844 8010 313. Opened in 2007, located near the entrance to the Dockyard and Dicken's World, and 1-2 miles from the town centre. Rooms about £60 without breakfast.
